DataElement.preferredName: Dietary Supplement And/Or Vitamin Taken Therapy Administered Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The text field that specifies the dietary supplements used.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Oral preparations containing dietary ingredient(s) intended to supplement the diet.  Dietary ingredients include vitamins, minerals, herbs, amino acids, extracts and metabolites._Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid._A group of organic food substances found in animals and plants in small quantities. They must be supplied in diet or dietary supplement and are essential for normal metabolism.:Having been accepted for some purpose; ingested as a medication.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Oral preparations containing dietary ingredient(s) intended to supplement the diet.  Dietary ingredients include vitamins, minerals, herbs, amino acids, extracts and metabolites._Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid._A group of organic food substances found in animals and plants in small quantities. They must be supplied in diet or dietary supplement and are essential for normal metabolism.

Concepts.definition: Oral preparations containing dietary ingredient(s) intended to supplement the diet.  Dietary ingredients include vitamins, minerals, herbs, amino acids, extracts and metabolites.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
A group of organic food substances found in animals and plants in small quantities. They must be supplied in diet or dietary supplement and are essential for normal metabolism.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having accepted for some purpose; ingested as a medication.

Concepts.definition: Having been accepted for some purpose; ingested as a medication.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Concomitant Medication per CDISC CM Definition

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the free-text field for therapy administered.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.

ReferenceDocuments.name: DCP-TEXT-1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Please list all supplements/vitamins you have taken during the 24 hours urine collection:
